author: @LANACION
title: El papa Francisco fue internado en Roma por una bronquitis - LA NACION
text:
ROMA.- Después de haber tenido las audiencias previstas en su agenda de la mañana, el papa Francisco fue internado este viernes en el hospital Gemelli “para algunos necesarios estudios diagnósticos y para seguir en ámbito hospitalario el tratamiento para curarse la bronquitis aún en curso”, informó el Vaticano, que también adelantó que canceló la audiencia jubilar prevista para este sábado y que no participará asimismo de actividades programadas para el domingo y el lunes, por lo que se deduce que quedará internado varios días. Por la tarde, en un breve parte el Vaticano informó que el Papa, de 88 años, comenzó la “ terapia farmacológica hospitalaria” correspondiente al “empeoramiento” de la bronquitis e hizo saber que “los primeros exámenes demuestran una infección de las vías respiratorias ”. Indicó, además, que “las condiciones clínicas son estables ” y que el Pontífice “presenta una leve alteración febril ”. El vocero papal, Matteo Bruni, al responder preguntas de los periodistas, obviamente alterados con la noticia y ya de guardia frente al policlínico, en tanto, tranquilizó los ánimos: contó que el Papa “está sereno, de buen humor ” y que estuvo leyendo algunos diarios. El clima en el Vaticano, en efecto, más que de alarma parecía ser de alivio ante el hecho de que Jorge Bergoglio se hubiera finalmente internado, dejándose, así, cuidar y poniéndole un freno a su obstinación a trabajar pese a su estado.
Por la mañana, la noticia de la internación de Francisco, que se conoció poco antes de las 11 locales, no sorprendió. Él mismo, siempre transparente con su salud, había dicho el miércoles pasado durante la audiencia general que seguía con bronquitis y que por eso no podía leer la catequesis, excusándose y dejándole la lectura a un colaborador, como ya había ocurrido la semana anterior. El domingo pasado, duranta la misa por el Jubileo de las Fuerzas Armadas, había pasado lo mismo: había interrumpido la lectura del sermón explicando que tenía “dificultad en la respiración”.
Pese a su bronquitis, que arrastra desde hace más de una semana, el Papa -indómito y probablemente sin escuchar el consejo de sus médicos- no había detenido o limitado sus actividades . Sino que había seguido con una agenda más que intensa, recibiendo obispos, personalidades, políticos y figuras. El único cambio, para no cansarse ni exponerse al frío invernal, había sido trasladar las audiencia desde la biblioteca del Palacio Apostólico a la residencia de Santa Marta, su hogar en el Vaticano.
El Papa Francisco es ayudado a sentarse en su sillón a su llegada a la audiencia general semanal en el Aula Pablo VI en el Vaticano el 5 de febrero de 2025 ALBERTO PIZZOLI� - AFP�

author: jcedeno
title: Aldo Corzo le pega a Alianza Lima reconociendo a Universitario
text:
Universitario de Deportes Aldo Corzo deja un contundente mensaje contra Alianza lima Un jugador de Universitario le pegó a Alianza Lima, tras enfrentar a Messi. Por Jose Cedeño Mendoza
30/01/2025 - 19:14hs EST
© GettyImages/ Edit Bv El palo de Aldo Corzo contra Alianza Lima La visita de Inter Miami con Lionel Messi para enfrentar a Universitario de Deportes es histórica . En este marco, el referente y capitán de Universitario, Aldo Corzo, dejó un contundente mensaje en redes sociales y le terminó pegando a Alianza Lima , club en el cual jugó.
Corzo escribió en sus redes sociales todo lo que significó la vista de Lionel Messi a Perú con el Inter Miami: “ Gracias a Dios y a mi Virgen por regalarme estos momentos inolvidables y también agradecer al equipo más grande del país por permitirme vivir estos momentos históricos “, escribió en su cuenta de instagram el jugador.
Asimismo, también se reveló que Corzo fue el jugador de Universitario de Deportes con el cual Lionel Messi terminó intercambiando su camiseta en el final del partido. El encuentro entre la ‘U’ y el Inter ha recorrido el mundo con varios posteos de diferentes instituciones.
Por otro lado, Universitario de Deportes ya pudo completar su particular historia con los jugadores más grandes del planeta. Puesto que, el club ya había enfrentado antes a Diego Maradona, a Pelé y ahora hizo lo propio contra Lionel Messi.
ver también
Joao Grimaldo tiene todo listo para volver al fútbol peruano: ¿Alianza Lima o Universitario de Deportes?
Corzo es capitán de Universitario de Deportes: (Foto: GettyImages)
Muchos aficionados también aprovecharon el mensaje de Corzo para entrar en el eterno debate de cuál de los dos equipos es el más grande. Universitario vive un momento actual inmejorable, puesto que, viene de ser bicampeón y es el equipo más importante de Perú.
Publicidad Publicidad ver también
¿Cuándo y contra quién debuta Universitario de Deportes en la Liga 1 2025?
Los números de Aldo Corzo en la temporada 2024 con Universitario de Deportes En la temporada 2024 con la camiseta de Universitario de Deportes, Aldo Corzo jugó un total de 36 partidos entre todas las competencias. Marcó 2 goles y no dio asistencias. Pese a su edad (35 años) es uno de los jugadores titulares en el equipo de Fabián Bustos.
Encuesta ¿Para ti cuál es el equipo más grande?
¿Para ti cuál es el equipo más grande?
YA VOTARON 0 PERSONAS
Comunicador Social titulado en Periodismo en 2021 por la Universidad Central del Ecuador. Cinco años de experiencia en el periodismo deportivo apegado a la redacción en diferentes casas como HIT Deportivo y Pichincha Comunicaciones. Actualmente en Bolavip cubriendo la información del deporte ecuatoriano especialmente el fútbol, con énfasis en equipos como Barcelona SC, Emelec, Independiente del Valle, Liga de Quito y también la Selección de Ecuador.

author: Chris Dall; MA
title: Study implicates hospital sinks as important source of resistant pathogen transmission | CIDRAP
text: Hospital sinks contaminated with carbapenemase-producing Enterobacteriaceae (CPE) are a significant source of transmission to patients, Israeli researchers [reported yesterday](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/infection-control-and-hospital-epidemiology/article/abs/sinktraps-are-a-major-source-for-carbapenemaseproducing-enterobacteriaceae-transmission/D5ACF476B6AA956C834DFD6A8FBDBDB1) in Infection Control & Hospital Epidemiology. Because CPE has become widespread in Israeli hospitals, and the hospital environment—specifically sink traps and water drainage systems—has been increasingly recognized as a source of multidrug-resistant organism outbreaks in hospitals, researchers at Israel's Sheba Medical Center set out to assess the extent and persistence of sink-drain and sink-outlet contamination in their facility and trace the possible transmission to patients. From 2017 to 2019, they sampled 592 patient-room sinks in 34 departments and analyzed isolates from sinks and patients. Persistent contamination, links to patients A total of 144 (24%) of 592 sinks were contaminated with CPE in 25 of 34 departments, and repeated sampling showed that 52% to 100% were contaminated at least once during the sampling period. During the study period, 318 patients acquired CPE during their hospitalization, with Klebsiella pneumoniae (46%), Escherichia coli (23%), and Enterobacter spp. (23%) the most common species. In 127 (40%) of those patients, no index case was detected but a contaminated sink was identified with the same CPE strain. In 57 additional cases, researchers identified CPE-contaminated sinks with a different bacterial species than that acquired by the patient — but with the same carbapenemase gene (bla), which suggests the sink could have been the source of transmission. For 20 cases with an identical sink-patient strain, sink-to-patient transmission was assumed because the sink was contaminated before the patient was hospitalized, and the patient's initial screening for CPE was negative. Genomic sequencing of two sink-patient isolate pairs identified two plasmids that were nearly identical. During 2 years of follow-up, repeated sink sampling showed that contamination of sink traps with CPE was persistent. The study authors called the findings worrisome. "This report adds to the accumulating data indicating the significant role of sinks in CPE transmission and suggests a paradigm change, in which infection control interventions to prevent CPE dissemination should focus on environmental control and appropriate behavior regarding the sink and its surroundings," they wrote.

author: Dawa Tsering
title: Sikyong Calls for Unified Action Against CCP to Bring Positive Change in China at 20th World Uyghur Congress Anniversary
text:
Sikyong Penpa Tsering delivering a speech during the opening session of the 20th anniversary of the World Uyghur Congress in Munich on 3 May 2024.
Munich: Sikyong Penpa Tsering of the Central Tibetan Administration addressed the 20th anniversary of the World Uyghur Congress in Munich on 3 May 2024 as the guest speaker for the opening ceremony.
To shed light on the long-standing partnership between Tibetans and Uyghurs in their shared pursuit of freedom and justice, Sikyong recounted the historic collaboration between Erkin Alptekin, founding President of the World Uyghur Congress, and the late Lodi Gyari, former Special Envoy of His Holiness the Dalai Lama, in their attempts to form an allied committee. Additionally, Sikyong also expressed his gratefulness for the opportunity of working with Rebiya Kadeer and Dolkun Isa, the former and incumbent Presidents of the World Uyghur Congress, in striving for shared endeavours.
To draw focus on the imperativeness of collaboration, Sikyong said, “I consider the Uyghurs, Mongolians, now event the Manchus, Tibetans, Hongkongers, Pro-Democracy leaders in China, and, if you want to include, Taiwan also. We are all travelling in the same boat against the brutal storm of Communist China.” On the same note, the Tibetan political leader reiterated his appeal to Europe and other nations to look at Tibetans and Uyghurs as a partner in countering the Chinese communist government’s atrocities and aggressions rather than as a subject of sympathy. “Nobody wants anarchy in China because it is the second largest economy in the world, and it will have serious consequences around the world . However, if we have to bring positive changes to China, then we need both internal and external forces. And we are the internal forces.”
Before concluding his address, Sikyong tabled, “Can we organise a big rally in Europe of all the Uyghurs, Tibetans, Hongkongers, Mongolians, Taiwanese, and pro-democratic Chinese leaders? If you are willing to do that, we are willing to join you or take the leadership.”
Apart from his participation in the 20th anniversary of World Uyghur Congress, in the span of past one week from 28 April to 4 May, Sikyong Penpa Tsering traveled to four countries and met with six Tibetan communities in Zurich, Switzerland (28 April); Milan, Trento, and Bolzano in Italy (1 May); Innsbruck in Austria (2 May); and Berlin in Germany (4 May). In addition to community engagement, Sikyong also met with government officials, parliamentarians, and representatives from universities.
In Innsbruck, Sikyong held meetings with Vice-Rector Prof. Dr. Bernhard Fügenschuh, Prof. Dr. Anna Gamper, a member of the university’s Senate, and a professor in the Department of Public Law, Constitutional, and Administrative Theory. During the discussions, the Vice-Rector offered a fully funded PhD or master’s scholarship opportunity for interested Tibetan students and expressed eagerness to enhance collaboration between the Central Tibetan Administration and Innsbruck University in the future . Sikyong Penpa Tsering expressed gratitude for the generous support and explored further opportunities for collaboration with the university leadership.
Currently in Berlin , from 4 to 8 May, Sikyong will engage in closed-door meetings with high-level government officials, among other key engagements.
Sikyong Penpa Tsering delivering a speech during the opening session of the 20th anniversary of the World Uyghur Congress in Munich on 3 May 2024.
Sikyong Penpa Tsering post his address at the 20th anniversary of the World Uyghur Congress in Munich.
Sikyong with Vice Rector and professors at innsbruck Univeristy.
Sikyong Penpa Tsering addressing the members of Tibetan community in Innsbruck, Austria.
Members of Tibetan community in Munich welcoming Sikyong Penpa Tsering.

author: La Redazione
title: La Cina può tagliare le emissioni del 30% in 10 anni se continua il boom delle fer
text:
immagine generata con IA Se Pechino riuscirà a mantenere lo stesso ritmo, la crescita sostenuta delle rinnovabili negli ultimi anni permetterà di ridurre le emissioni della Cina del 30% entro il 2035 . La flessione riporterebbe il 1° inquinatore mondiale sulla traiettoria giusta per limitare il riscaldamento globale a 1,5°C. Lo calcola un rapporto del CREA , il Center for Research on Energy and Clean Air di Helsinki.
Entro febbraio 2025 la Cina, come tutti i paesi, dovrà presentare all’Onu i suoi nuovi Contributi nazionali volontari (NDC), il piano di riduzione delle emissioni . È la 1° volta che Pechino rivede la sua traiettoria di gas serra dopo aver preso l’impegno di raggiungere il picco delle emissioni entro il 2030.
L’ambizione dell’NDC di Pechino è dirimente per capire se riusciremo a rispettare l’Accordo di Parigi o no. Dal 2015 , quando è stato approvato l’Accordo, l a Cina è responsabile del 30% delle emissioni globale di gas serra e del 90% dell’aumento delle emissioni di anidride carbonica .
Emissioni Cina, la traiettoria compatibile con 1,5 gradi Cosa deve contenere l’NDC cinese per essere compatibile con 1,5 gradi? Quali sono gli obiettivi settoriali di riduzione delle emissioni della Cina che dovrebbe indicare il documento di Pechino? Il rapporto del CREA traccia la rotta indicando quali sono gli obiettivi effettivamente raggiungibili dal gigante asiatico se adotta politiche in grado di sostenere la crescita delle rinnovabili. Nello specifico:
Emissioni di CO2 : la Cina può raggiungere almeno il -30% entro il 2035, rispetto al 2023. Servirebbe indicare un obiettivo assoluto di riduzione per catalizzare gli sforzi Emissioni non-CO2 : è fattibile una riduzione di almeno il 35% entro il 2035. Questi gas serra sono 1/6 delle emissioni totali del paese Elettricità : lo sviluppo delle fer può ridurre del 30% le emissioni del settore elettrico e aumentare la quota di energia non fossile nel consumo energetico totale a oltre il 40%. Il valore di riferimento per questo obiettivo è una capacità installata di rinnovabili di 5.000 GW entro il 2035 e lo stop a tutte le nuove centrali a carbone senza abbattimento di CO2 Industria : le emissioni industriali possono calare del 25% entro il 2035, soprattutto grazie a siderurgico (-45%) e cemento (-20%). È richiesta una quota del 30% di acciaio low-carbon (tramite forni ad arco elettrico e idrogeno) e un’espansione dell’ETS nazionale Trasporti : le emissioni possono tornare ai livelli del 2020 con una quota di mercato degli EV al 60% (oggi supera di poco il 50% tra BEV e ibride plug-in) Edilizia : le emissioni degli edifici possono diminuire di almeno il 40% entro il 2035, tra standard low-carbon per tutti i nuovi edifici, la riqualificazione del 25% del patrimonio immobiliare e una quota delle pompe di calore del 40% entro il 2035

author: Kirsten Dorman
title: Arizona State University police chief retires after being put on leave over protests
text: Arizona State University police chief retires after being put on leave over protests Arizona State University’s chief of campus police, Michael Thompson, has announced his retirement. The move comes after Thompson was placed on paid administrative leave, following complaints filed related to his actions [during the late-April encampment on the school’s Tempe campus.](https://www.kjzz.org/2024-04-26/content-1878304-69-people-arrested-setting-pro-palestinian-encampment-asus-tempe-campus) Thompson was recorded via cellphone video cutting into and throwing tents on the Alumni Lawn. University officials confirmed that Thompson had left a previous meeting to respond to the protest. Following the encampment, 72 people were arrested. A spokesperson confirmed that Thompson’s retirement will be effective Aug. 24, adding that ASU wishes him well. 1 of 9 Protest supporting Palestinians at Arizona State University's Tempe campus on Friday, April 26, 2024. Nate Engle/KJZZ 2 of 9 A protest in support of Palestinians at Arizona State University's Tempe campus on Friday, April 26, 2024. Nate Engle/KJZZ More Arizona education news - The Show spoke with Andi Fourlis, superintendent of Mesa Public Schools, to learn about how the school district approaches technology as a learning tool. - MCCCD is joining the National Applied Artificial Intelligence Consortium, which will receive $2.8 million in funding from the National Science Foundation to develop and implement AI courses, certificates and degree programs. - Scottsdale police are investigating accusations that the treasurer of a Scottsdale parent-teacher association drained the organization's savings account and then fled. - The state Board of Regents has cut down a search committee’s list of prospects to those whom it will invite for interviews to be the next president of the University of Arizona. - The Show spoke to Maria Polletta, a reporter who covers education for the Arizona Center for Investigative Reporting, about what Project 2025 says about education.

author: archyworldyscom
title: Happy! This is the complete list of Okezone Table Tennis Champions 2024
text:
loading…
PDAM emerged as the 2024 Okezone Table Tennis Champion after defeating Jasa Raharja Putera A in the final round with a score of 2-0 at GOR Pertamina Simprug, Jakarta, on Saturday (31/8/2024). Photo/Wkanto Arungbudoyo
JAKARTA – PDAM to come out as a champion Table tennis Okezone 2024 after defeating Jasa Raharja Putera A in the final round with a score of 2-0 at GOR Pertamina Simprug, Jakarta on Saturday (31/8/2024). PDAM’s victory was confirmed by Titin in the women’s singles who successfully defeated Lany in three sets, 10-12, 12-10, 11-4 and 11-9.
Meanwhile, PUPR Ministry occupies the third place after beating Jasa Marga in the race for third place with a score of 2-0!
With these results, PUPR Ministry has the right to take home a trophy and IDR 3 million in cash. Jasa Marga herself pocketed IDR 2 million in cash and a trophy.
The best fan category went to BRIN and PDAM. They never stop expressing their support, so they deserve to be rewarded with a cash prize worth 500 thousand IDR.
The 2024 Okezone Table Tennis event was attended by 34 teams from companies, government agencies and media. The competition for the championship rankings was fierce from the round of 32.
Below is the list of Okezone Table Tennis Champions 2024:
1st place: PDAM
2nd place: Jasa Raharja Putera
3rd place: Ministry of PUPR
4th place: Jasa Marga
Best fan: BRIN and PDAM
(wib)
#Happy #complete #list #Okezone #Table #Tennis #Champions

author: Anthony Macuk (KGW)
title: Oregon health officials urge vaccination amid surge in flu cases
text:
PORTLAND, Ore. — Oregon is experiencing a sharp spike in the number of flu cases reported statewide, and doctors and health officials are urging residents to get vaccinated
[if they haven't already](/article/news/health/best-time-for-flu-shot/283-65a9ff39-f4be-43c2-9e97-918157b74ebb); not only for the flu but also for RSV and COVID-19, both of which are expected to see seasonal spikes during the holidays.
"Influenza season has definitely arrived," state epidemiologist Dr. Dean Sidelinger said in a statement. "And, RSV isn’t far behind."
The state saw 58 flu-related hospitalizations during the week of Dec. 8-14, up from 39 the week before, and test result positivity climbed from 10.6% to 18.7% over the same time period, according to the
[latest weekly report](https://www.oregon.gov/oha/PH/DISEASESCONDITIONS/COMMUNICABLEDISEASE/DISEASESURVEILLANCEDATA/INFLUENZA/Documents/data/FluBites.pdf) from the Oregon Health Authority. The highest test positivity rates are in the northern and eastern parts of the state.
The state's positive flu test percentage began climbing in early November, and hospitalizations began to pick up about two weeks later and have been climbing steadily since then, with the fastest increase among people over 50.
The test positivity rate appears to be climbing at about the same pace as it did during last year's flu season, although the season appears to be off to a later start this time around; the sharp rise began about a month earlier in the 2023-2024 season.
"Every respiratory virus season has the potential to be a bad respiratory virus season, and activity levels we’re seeing for both influenza and RSV are telling us the 2024-2025 season is no exception," Sidelinger said. "Everyone should get the flu and COVID-19 vaccines now, and those in high-risk groups — infants, young children, older adults, and pregnant persons — should also get the RSV vaccine."
RSV vaccine protection lasts longer than one year, Sidelinger said during a news conference Thursday, so people who got the shot last year don't need to get it again this year, but anyone in a high-risk group who hasn't gotten one recently should make an effort to get one — and everyone should get an updated flu shot.
"Right now I'm disappointed in the vaccine numbers that we see," he said. "We see our flu vaccine trailing below previous years here in Oregon. That's a trend that most other states are seeing. And that's hard, because we've seen that decrease in seasonal flu vaccines each year over the last few years. And while this vaccine doesn't provide 100% protection, it really does help prevent illness in most people and it really does keep people out of the hospital."
COVID booster update rates are also trailing behind this year, he said. Both vaccines are widely available and covered by insurance.
"We also need to remember the importance of basic health habits like hand washing, covering coughs, wearing masks when necessary, and staying home when feeling unwell," Dr. Kathryn Glassberg, medical director for quality with Kaiser Permanente in Portland, said in a statement. "We’re seeing flu cases begin to tick up, and with the virus circulating alongside COVID-19 and other respiratory illnesses, it’s vital to stay proactive about our health to protect yourself and your loved ones this season."
